meanings.definition: The act of behaving obsequiously to gain advantage.
meanings.sent1: Her sycophantism towards the boss was obvious to everyone in the office.
meanings.sent2: The politician's sycophantism towards the wealthy donors was shameless.
meanings.sent3: His sycophantism was so extreme that he even offered to shine the boss's shoes.
meanings.sent4: The sycophantism of the salesperson was like a shadow, always following the manager.
meanings.sent5: The sycophantism of the student was like a bright neon sign, impossible to ignore.

meanings.definition: A person who acts obsequiously to gain advantage.
meanings.sent1: The office sycophantism always tried to flatter the boss for special treatment.
meanings.sent2: She recognized the sycophantism in his compliments and knew he had an ulterior motive.
meanings.sent3: The sycophantism in the room was so thick, you could cut it with a knife.
meanings.sent4: His sycophantism was like a mask, hiding his true intentions behind false praise.
meanings.sent5: The sycophantism of the group was like a chorus of insincere voices, all singing the same tune.
